channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2023111025
item.description:
Report X-2023111025

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PACKAGE WEARING PROPER PPE AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE LEAKING ON FLOOR OF TRAILER. USING APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CONTAINED LEAKER AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023110988
item.description:
Report X-2023110988

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023110988 SequenceEvent: Package was found damaged on trailer during unload. Package was corroded from the liquid inside the bottles. Package was isolated and put in a hazardous bin. DescribePack: Package was wet and tearing apart. Oil dry was found on the package which implies that this package was already discovered to be damaged before the trailer it was on was dispatched. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated and put inside of a hazardous bin with a top to seal the fumes. 2. X-2023110991 SequenceEvent: Package was found damaged on trailer during unloading. The package was isolated and put into a hazardous bin. DescribePack: Package was corroded due to the liquid from the bottles. Box was torn. There were signs of a cleanup found while unloading which means it was found damaged on the trailer before it was dispacted from previous station. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put inside of a hazardous bin and closed up to stop the release of fumes

item.title: Report E-2023100694
item.description:
Report E-2023100694

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/23/2023, at 1409 hours, personnel in the CSXT Boyles Yard in Birmingham, AL, reported GATX 60281, a loaded tank car of Molten Sulfur, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, HF Sinclair, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2023-10-23-00150). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a vapor release coming from the manway of the rail car. Contractor personnel determined that 6 of the 6 manway cover swing bolts were less than tool tight. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative: Mike Ernst (214-871-3590). Contractor personnel properly secured the manway swing bolts using a 24” wrench; this stopped all product vapor from leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023110520
item.description:
Report X-2023110520

  • City: DOTHAN
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA found a one gallon plastic container of Zep Concentrated Industrial Purple Degreaser with a loose cap foaming and leaking into the packaging box. DescribePack: Cap was loose on a one gallon jug of Zep Concentrated Industrial Purple Degreaser. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QA placed the damaged HazMat into a Hazardous Material box.

item.title: Report E-2023110499
item.description:
Report E-2023110499

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that a pallet had punctured the one metal 55 gallon drum of Dytek A amine (un2735) and had released 2 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
